intro: Piper indecorum, commonly known as the Indian pepper or piper, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Piperaceae family and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in herbal medicine. The plant thrives in moist, shady environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
